steps.title: Stand on the left side of your bicycle.
steps.content: Stand on the left side of your bicycle.

steps.title: Position the left pedal at the 10:00 position (as on a clock).
steps.content: Position the left pedal at the 10:00 position (as on a clock).

steps.title: Put your left foot on the left pedal.
steps.content: Put your left foot on the left pedal.

steps.title: Push off twice on the ground with your right foot, as this will give you enough momentum to swing your right leg over the seat without falling off.
steps.content: Push off twice on the ground with your right foot, as this will give you enough momentum to swing your right leg over the seat without falling off. [1] X Research source

steps.title: As your bicycle begins to move, swing your right leg over.
steps.content: As your bicycle begins to move, swing your right leg over.

steps.title: Sit down on the bicycle seat and pedal away.
steps.content: Sit down on the bicycle seat and pedal away. Note: If you feel comfortable starting on the right side of the bicycle and pedaling first with the right foot, that's fine too.

steps.title: Throw your leg over the middle bar and stand flat-footed with one foot on each side of the bike.
steps.content: Throw your leg over the middle bar and stand flat-footed with one foot on each side of the bike. You should be standing just in front of the bike seat, and not fully seated yet. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Position one pedal at 10:00 and place your foot on the pedal while leaning a little to the other side.
steps.content: Position one pedal at 10:00 and place your foot on the pedal while leaning a little to the other side. Your other foot which is still flat on the ground will help you keep your balance.

steps.title: Push down with the foot on the pedal, and stand up on it at the same time.
steps.content: Push down with the foot on the pedal, and stand up on it at the same time. This will raise you up and allow you to sit on the seat.

steps.title: Place your other foot on the pedal, push forward and you are riding!
steps.content: Place your other foot on the pedal, push forward and you are riding!

steps.title: Probably want to apply some brake pressure so the bike won't run away
steps.content: Probably want to apply some brake pressure so the bike won't run away

steps.title: Wear a helmet.
steps.content: Wear a helmet. This method is not easy.

steps.title: Start with the left pedal at ten o'clock and stand on the left side of the bike, holding the handlebars.
steps.content: Start with the left pedal at ten o'clock and stand on the left side of the bike, holding the handlebars.

steps.title: Run alongside the bike, pushing the bike by the handlebars until you get up to speed.
steps.content: Run alongside the bike, pushing the bike by the handlebars until you get up to speed. [3] X Research source

steps.title: When you're ready to mount, jump off the left foot and swing your right leg over the bike.
steps.content: When you're ready to mount, jump off the left foot and swing your right leg over the bike. You should land with your right thigh on the seat.

steps.title: Push down on the left pedal and catch the right pedal on its way up.
steps.content: Push down on the left pedal and catch the right pedal on its way up.
